title: Developing Instructional Design Decision-Making Competencies for Technology Integration

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with foundational digital tools and basic concepts of instructional design
context.additional_context: For administrators/leaders needing to master effective instructional design methods using technology in language education. Self-directed learning and collaboration are required in BYOD environments.

learning_goals: Learners can perform at least three formative design activities (prototyping and revisions) during the technology-integrated instructional design process.
Learners can apply at least five decision-making criteria (e.g., learner proficiency level, goal alignment) when selecting technology tools suitable for language education contexts.
Learners can improve their design proposals at least twice based on peer feedback to finalize deliverables.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
